utterance.speaker: Voice of a woman
utterance.content: Keep breathing. Nice and slow.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Now, the first couple of shots will show you if the sights are off or the barrel's bent.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Yeah! You did it!

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I didn't.

utterance.speaker: Carny
utterance.content: You just won your girlfriend a teddy bear.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: And then Thursday night, this physicist is giving a lecture in Brooklyn. It's about time travel and the grandfather paradox. I don't know if you're busy…

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: I'm really happy that we've been hanging out so much.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah, I-I like you too. Heh.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Can you put down the bear? Henry…

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: What? I can't.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: I know. You have a girlfriend. It's just… she never seems… to want to do anything with you. Are you crying?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, I have allergies. I must just be, like, tearing up.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Henry, I think that's blood.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: What? I-it…

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 35-year-old male cries blood, and he's not vampire Bill. Go!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Should we ask?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, my favorite companion is retiring from "companning." So I'm interviewing replacements. Thank you… Butterscotch. Is that a family name?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How long are you gonna be using the office for sex games? Just so I can plan my day.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sex and work? I'm not a savage. I asked for a cappuccino.

utterance.speaker: Butterscotch
utterance.content: That's what this is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, cappuccinos got a nice, stiff foam on it. This is wetter than… oh… almost slipped there. Well, thank you, Ms. Scotch, but poor foaming's a deal breaker. Could you ask the next candidate to come in?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Initial exam showed no sign of trauma or subconjunctival hemorrhage.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Lymphocytosis? ALC's in normal range, but it's in the high end of normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take a seat, Fawn. And tell me, what's your favorite Woody Allen movie?

utterance.speaker: Fawn
utterance.content: Annie Hall.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're interviewing hookers but not gonna talk to them about sex?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sex is a given. They're hookers. Defend your choice.

utterance.speaker: Fawn
utterance.content: It's the most popular.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lymphocytosis works. Maybe we should take another look at the blood.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Could also be cavernous sinus thrombosis. Clot builds up pressure at the base of the brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rerun the patient's blood panel and get a CT venogram of his head. Let's see which one of you is right. How are you with small appliance repair?

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Uh, this cavernous sinus thing, is it dangerous?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If Henry's got it, we can treat it with a combo of drugs and surgery. Success rate is over 70%.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Amy's his girlfriend. I'm the neighbor. I did leave a message at their number.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Do you wanna try her cell? Be here for a few more hours at least.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Oh, she doesn't have one. She worries about radiation.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: I could stop by on my way home. She knows who I am, right?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: You don't need to, but thanks.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Have you ever paid for sex?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Every guy who's ever seen a Merchant Ivory movie has paid for sex. No. It just… seems too demeaning to women.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Given the things you've done to women, that seems arbitrary.

utterance.speaker: Young man
utterance.content: You're Chi Park, right?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Who's asking?

utterance.speaker: Young man
utterance.content: Uh, you called about my guitar flyer.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're Micah. This guy's selling a 1974 Gibson SG standard in tobacco for $1,250.

utterance.speaker: Micah
utterance.content: Yeah, actually, I came in to tell you I already sold it. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Oh, um… thanks anyway.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe we should check for diabetes. Could weaken conjunctival vessels. And shut up.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If I'm wrong then why is he coming back?

utterance.speaker: Micah
utterance.content: My band is rehearsing tomorrow night. You should come by and jam with us.

utterance.speaker: Micah
utterance.content: Great. Call me.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'll break your face.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is the talent portion of the interview.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Okay. You like cards. But you can juggle. I fail to see how this would be of benefit to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if I'm busy? Have you got anything else?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: CT showed no clots or malformations. Park and Taub ruled out lymphocytosis and diabetes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, since you have nothing of relevance to report, I assume that you're here to toss your panties in the ring.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Patient's got a mysterious girlfriend he really wants to see. She's unreachable by phone, and the neighbor's never even seen her.

utterance.speaker: Debbie
utterance.content: He's gay.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think he's a junkie. The girlfriend is a fix. The guy's inhaling glue.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can you repair a blender?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Can you bite me? Go search the patient's home. Well, thank you, ladies. I've seen a lot of very talented candidates. Got a tough decision the next few days. This is the part I hate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well… this is not exactly a crack den.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Doesn't exactly look like a woman lives here, either.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: "To Amy. I love you."

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Okay. She exists. Doesn't mean he's not a drug addict.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's good you're playing it cool with House. Once he gets a rise out of someone…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm not crazy about the whole hooker thing, but I get it. Other than the fact that it's exploitative and dangerous for women, you get what you need without any of the emotional baggage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're not seeing anyone I take it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I've been volunteering at the Trenton Free Clinic. Keeps me busy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You volunteer every night and every weekend? No time to grab dinner?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What's more important — making small talk over ravioli or helping people who are less fortunate?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: With that rationale, none of us should ever eat again.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Let's just say I'm not hungry right now.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Oh, God…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I don't think she's breathing. Do you think she OD'd?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That or he killed her. Pulse?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll call the coroner.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I don't think that's gonna be necessary.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: This one works in financial district. She can get tips, give you leg up in market. What is "fudgey Gonzalez"?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, imagine a "vanilla Gonzalez," but from the other side.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm about to make a decision, but there's still time for you to sneak under the wire.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: My favorite Woody Allen movie is Melinda and Melinda. Our patient is not a junkie, but he does have a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I call her my "girlfriend" because people understand that. If I explained it, they'd just think I was a weirdo.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're not here to judge anyone's fetish.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I'm not a pervert. It's not like I'm more attracted to dolls than humans.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So you don't have sex with her?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: It's not just about that.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Does the doll talk to you?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I know she's not a real person. In a lot of ways, she's better than a person. I can tell her things, and she won't argue with me or make fun of me. I come home every night, and I know she'll be there waiting.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So is your toaster.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No one in the world has an emotional attachment to a toaster. But a lot of people are willing to spend $7,000 on women like Amy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Have you ever tried an actual—

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm 35. I've been in relationships. Just none of them fulfilled me. And one day, I saw this website, and… maybe the perfect woman's out there somewhere, but it's not worth going through what it would take to find her. Amy makes me happy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're swelling.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: It's sort of hot in here.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Bleeding plus two new symptoms. Fever and neurological.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not sure about that last one. I think he's just… weird. He wasn't hallucinating. He didn't have a thought disorder.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And you don't think it's "disordered" to talk to—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not all that different from talking to your cat or a Teddy bear.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You don't have sex with your cat or Teddy bear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you did, you'd probably talk to them more. Guy loves an imaginary being who's never going to respond to him. He's no crazier than millions of churchgoers.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You think anything off about any patient is a symptom. This guy buys flowers. Real flowers for a piece of plastic in a dress.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's just running away. He hangs out with a doll, he never needs to fear rejection.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's sad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You do understand the irony here? Every person in this room has a sex doll. At least the patient has the stones to be honest about it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ooh, a metaphor. What you didn't foresee is that is that I actually do have a sex doll.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your doll is your kids. Yours is your parents, yours is your charity. All excuses for not being in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's not wrong.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I have meaningless sex with random strangers. Thanks for the insight, but I stopped that months ago. I actually had a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My dating is getting in the way of my dating?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't go looking for the right person. You just shack up with whoever's in the room, and then you get surprised and/or divorced when it doesn't work out. I'm surprised you haven't asked Adams out yet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'll bail.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's right. The obvious solution is for me to hand my kids over to your parents.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can we stop trying to argue the premise and move onto figuring out why it is that you're all social morons?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You do understand the irony here. You mocking us for avoiding relationships, but you can't handle losing your "doll." You’re spending all this time and energy interviewing for a new one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. That is stupid.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What about the patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dude's banging a sex doll. A festering cesspool of bodily fluids and associated bacteria. Swab her out and find out which one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need you. Please don't quit. You're the only hooker I know who can tune a piano. If it's about the money, then I can up you to three nights a week.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I'm getting married, House. His name's Harris. He's a certified accountant, he loves schlocky horror movies, and he just moved in. We're very happy.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: He knows. We've talked about it, and he accepts me for who I am.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. He… If he accepted who you were, he would not be making you give up your career. Women need their own identities, their own livelihoods. Otherwise, why was I smoking all those Virginia Slims?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I know this is weird for you, but you need to figure out a way to be okay with it. I'll miss you, too.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I feel like the stirrups are overkill.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I've never done a pelvic on a doll before. I'm unfamiliar with the protocol. I'm pretty skeeved out right now. I'm not gonna lie.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What House said back there—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't just date whoever shows up. I mean, I did meet women in the hospital, but they weren't just flings.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Basically, you're explaining why you're not going to ask me out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's not what I was — did you want me to ask you out?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yeah. I told Park to tell Taub to tell House to pass you that note. It's completely clean in there.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He said he just bathed her. Adams… there's a swelling beneath the skin… 3-inch mass.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It feels like a tumor.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: CT showed an air-filled mass in the doll's abdomen. It's probably just a chemical reaction. Henry left her too close to a heating pipe or something.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This guy brushes her hair every morning, brings home movies for them to watch together. You think he tosses her in a broom closet at the end of each day?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: More likely than it getting stomach cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How about clostridium? Bacteria got trapped in the airtight cavity, produced gas…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It doesn't explain the neurological issue.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can explain that the same way we explain the tooth fairy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I get to play Solomon. Cut the doll open.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can't just destroy the patient's property. That thing cost 7 grand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Exactly. Ask him for consent. If he says yes, then we get to go hunting bacteria. If he says no, there's no need because he's crazy, and we need a different theory. See ya. Gotta go build a temple.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You sure? It won't be able to heal when we're done.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: But you think she could tell you what's wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Should we take her to the procedure room?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's not a “her,” which means we can do this anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Adams… you can know something's not real and still love it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think the procedure room might be better for this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You are a horrible person.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All I need is to break up one marriage. You've broken up three of your own. You're like the Stephen Hawking of killing relationships. Actually, no, Stephen Hawking is the Stephen Hawking of—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay. I have work to do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your computer is off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sorry, I can't hear you over my "stereo."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why do you assume that marriage is better than hooking? We don't know anything about the guy. He could be a serial killer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Even if that were true, it would still be a toss-up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're a coward.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Absolutely, if what he's afraid of is other damsels. Your last relationship failed so miserably, you ended up in jail. Now you're clinging to this hooker when there are about 3 billion other women out there who aren't call girls, some of whom are attractive and intelligent, one of whom is living in your apartment and is married to you!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You shouldn't sleep with Chase.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Thank God. You got here just in time. What do you have against him?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Nothing, but House has a way of getting into people's heads.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Just like last week when he was prying into your relationship with Chase? It was silly then, and it's silly now.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Why was it silly then? I'm not 5'9" with curves and flowing hair, so it's impossible for me to get it on with a good-looking guy?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Wow. Do you resent me? You're the quirky, hardworking sophomore and I'm the evil cheerleader who steals boys? If you're not getting any, it's not my fault.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Should we get the one with the panda on it or the bird? Good choice. Pandas eat only bamboo, they know nothing about cereal.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Your little girl is adorable.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thanks. She keeps me very busy.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: You and her mom must be very proud.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her mother… died in childbirth.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We're growing cultures now, but she looked clean, and there was no telltale smell. I'm guessing the lump was just an air bubble that got trapped in the mold.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: You bandaged her up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I threw in some stitches, too. Just wanted to make her look her best. Do you want me to put her in her chair? Henry? Call a code!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You looking at the apartment with those or the transit of Mercury?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: If night comes, you'll be thanking me. They're seeking heat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's an accountant. How late do you think he's going to party?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I bought jar to pee in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We heard crackles in Henry's lungs. We diuresed him, but he still needs oxygen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Echo shows normal heart function. Could be high output failure from anemia.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hematocrit was rock normal.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Say "mushroom," charge $2. Say "truffle," charge $5. Is that the man who wants to marry hooker?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably. But he's not the one we're after.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Should we ask?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh! How rude of me not to situate you. I'm doing Emily a favor. We're going to track her fiancé until Dominika can seduce and expose him as the lying cheater I need him to be.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm guessing she didn't ask for this favor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, you know, the noblest gifts are the ones we give anonymously.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Crackles are nonspecific. Hypoxia plus bleeding could indicate D.I.C. or some other—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No neurological symptoms? I knew your bleeding heart would bring you around. Too bad it's also taking you off the market. And by market, I mean Chase. Come on, buck up, Chase. There's always Park. Unless… How did band practice go?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does she look like she's lying?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Kind of.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Popo needed a ride to the doctor, and my mom couldn't, so—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're terrified of dating because… a previous relationship ended because your latent rage made you vicious in arguments. Or—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or reincarnation. In a past life, she was Anne Boleyn.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting. Taub feels confident enough to turn the spotlight on himself. It's almost as if he wants me to ask… what's her name?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wendy Jacobson. 33, Brown grad, family therapist.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice choice. Since you got two families to "therapize."

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: First date we didn't discuss everything important—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So it was just a one-night stand.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're wrong. I actually like her. I'm going to see her again.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mazel tov. Great relationships often start with snap decisions aimed at proving me wrong.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Air bubble in the doll could mean the silicone is degrading. If he hailed some particles…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Silicone deposition. That could work. Start him on plasmapheresis. Now, turning to Adams, my theory is tripartite—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Want to hear my thesis? It's kind of interesting.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: No man comes out. But old naked lady in 3-C is eating whole block of cheese.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Will this hurt?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No, you might feel a little cold, though.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, no, it's-it's good that she's here. Molly, I'd like you to meet Amy.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I'm serious. I know it seems a little strange, but she means a lot to me.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: But you just got here. Sit down.

utterance.speaker: Molly
utterance.content: Yeah, but I-I said that I only had a second. Enjoy the handouts.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Listen, um, I have to admit something.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her mom isn't dead. We're separated.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: Was that a different baby?

utterance.speaker: Wendy
utterance.content: That was a different baby.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Like this?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: You're talking?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It's not all I can do.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Amy, there are doctors…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Shh…

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just put your hands on me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pushing lorazepam. If it wasn't neurological before, it sure is now.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Right upper quadrant's distended. He's hallucinating because his liver's failing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Elevated transaminases confirm liver failure. We'll have to put him on the transplant list in a couple days.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's clearly not the silicone. Could be vasculitis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Serologies were negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, if you want Adams to hear, you might want to not stand so conspicuously far away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm making coffee. And sometimes, I date co-workers. Like everyone else on the planet.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hepatic fibrosis. If it damaged his platelets, it'd explain the bleeding.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unexpected. I actually thought you might agree with my theory. Because that would mean nothing's your fault. You fell into relationships based on proximity. Of course they failed. But I guess I was wrong. You picked perfect women. You just screwed it up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How about all five of us live together and the $7,000 sex doll? It'll solve all our hang-ups.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Adams suggests that we all sleep together, and your issue is high prices?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pretty sure she was joking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, I'm 99% sure that you're right, but I would never forgive myself—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Those dolls are only $5,000. He must have had it customized somehow. Oh, like, you didn't check the website?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I guess we don't need to ask how your dating life is going.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was curious.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Hepatic fibrosis wouldn't cause difficulty breathing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It would if liver failure opened pulmonary av shunts.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fibrosis fits. Start the patient on steroids and find out how he pimped his ride.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because I don't know the answer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey. Foosball?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't. Marriage to destroy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Okay" as in passive-aggressive reverse psychology? Or as in depressed resignation

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: "Okay" as in I changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Expand.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, it's morally reprehensible and bound to fail, but in a weird way, it's a step forward. This thing with Emily.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Contract.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's real without being real. It's a long-term relationship that can't actually hurt you. It's, um… a stepping stone. It means you want more.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, passive-aggressive reverse psychology. Got it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Try not to come on too strong, okay? Just get to know him a little. Ease into it.

utterance.speaker: Domonika
utterance.content: Why would I ease?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True. You could just walk up and stick your hand down his pants, but I heard there's a middle step.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Men want to have sex.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I'm Jennifer, new to marketing department.

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Harris. Accounts receivable.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Oh, interesting. Do you want to get out of here and have sex?

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Uh, sure. You know, I got 45 minutes left on my lunch break.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Where you wanna go?

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Cheating? What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why, I hope you're speaking out of some deep kind of moral relativism because—

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Who are you people?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not Emily's fiancée.

utterance.speaker: Harris
utterance.content: Emily's my sister.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We called the company that made Amy. They said they modeled her after some photos you sent them. Who is she?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: We met last Christmas. She's a yoga instructor. Totally different from me. She-she loved Chopin, hated Indian food. She changed entire my life for 17 weeks.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: My husband cheated on me… with a girl he met on the plane coming back from our honeymoon. It's not easy to get past things like that.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: She wasn't unfaithful. She didn't betray me. She just… she just wasn't in love with me.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I know Amy's not going to break your heart. But she's also not going to change your life.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Sorry. What's happening to me?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Is your neck stiff?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think you have meningitis.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I'm not leaving the business. I'm just leaving you. I didn't want you to feel bad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So let me get this straight. I'm being dumped by a hooker… who's worried about my feelings?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You're married.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Half your clients are married. And you're a hooker.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: My other guys sneak around, but you'll take me into the bedroom while your wife's in the next room. That's just… mean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God. The marriage, it's a sham. The only really thing about it is the green card she's going to get at the end of it. So, if you want to get the meter running…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: It's still mean.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not a marriage. It's a felony.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I've seen how she looks at you when you're together. Trust me. She likes you. And I've seen how you look at her.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Fever's up 105. He's not responding to meds. At this rate, he'll be dead by the time we get the cultures back.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Spinal fluid was full of white cells. Meningitis could be carcinomatous.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Cytology showed nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: An amoebic infection would cause fever and meningitis.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: But not liver failure.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It could if he had a clot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How could amoebas get past his cribriform plate? He went swimming in a frozen lake in New Jersey?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Adams said his ex-girlfriend was a yoga instructor.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Maybe he sprained his chakras.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yoga nuts are way more likely to be into alternative medicine. He has this little weird teapot in his house.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Um, little. Weird. Teapot-ish.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Like that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You think he drinks some sort of toxic herbal tea?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes… if by "tea," you mean salted tap water. And by "drink," you mean poured up his nose. His girlfriend didn't just leave him with a broken heart. She left him with a neti pot. It's an Indian method of… clearing the sinuses during allergy season. Also known as now. The distilled water can act as a snot flushing system. With tap water, it can act as an amoeba delivery system to the fluids around the brain. Start him on metronidazole. If he's lucky, he'll get to see his plastic children walk down the aisle.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: My neck feels much better.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Your fever's gone, and your liver function's almost back to normal. You should be able to go home soon.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I'm going to have some hospital bills to pay. I don't suppose used sex dolls go for anything online. Dr. Adams? Can I get your email?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I just thought maybe we could see each other again.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: No, I know. It's a professionalism thing, but you won't be my doctor when I get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's not that. It's—

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: What is it? You said I should change my life. You were talking about yourself, too. I know you were.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Henry, I-I think you should ask Molly out.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: I should have known this would happen.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're a good guy, Henry. You deserve more than a doll. Promise me you'll keep trying.

utterance.speaker: Henry
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Date tonight? So she can't deal. There's someone out there who can. You just got to find her.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'd love to prove House wrong, but… I ruined my marriage, broke two people's hearts, had two kids who are always going to wonder why I didn't love their mommy enough. It's better if I just… focus on what I do have. Give that band guy a call.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not that good at guitar. Or flirting or small talk. I'm not as pretty as Adams, I have stuffy clothes, and I hate my hair.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Adams works 80 hours a week fixing bunions on hobos because she can't face getting to know someone new. Trust me. You find a boyfriend, she'll be the jealous one.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: See you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Do you…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Want to get a drink?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Oh, I… It's just, um… I think it's time for a change.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, mom. I'm still at work. I'll be home in a couple hours. Love you too.

utterance.speaker: Micah
utterance.content: Ready? One, two, three, four.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: ♪♫ They say we're young and we don't know, we won't find out until we grow

utterance.speaker: Micah
utterance.content: ♪♫ Well, I don't know if all that's true 'cause you got me and baby I got you

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I fix blender.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So I see.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I had fun seducing hooker's fake fiancée. Sorry it didn't work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought I'd take a break from the whole hooker thing.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I think maybe you need milk shake. Is pistachio.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm… gonna go to bed. See you tomorrow.
